title: Print, "Het Loo Palace, Staircase", ca. 1700
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, lower left: L Escallier de La Maison/ Royalle de Loo/ invent par D. Marot Architecte/ de Sa Majest Britanicque; at lower margin: fait avec Previllege des Etats Generaux des Provinces Vrie, et d'Hollande et W.S.
dimensions:
Overall: 34 x 22.8cm (13 3/8 x 9in.)
Platemark/Repeat (Platemark/Repeat): 27.7 x 19.5cm (10 7/8 x 7 11/16in.)
Mat (Mat): 35.6 x 45.7cm (14 x 18in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund
description: Design for the interior of a building. In the foreground, a staircase leads up to a balcony with columns and sculptural elements. Three figures are pictured in the center of the balcony. The opens up to the outside and there is a view of the landscape. The ceiling has a large oculus.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Het Loo Palace, Staircase", ca. 1700.
ca. 1700. Etching on white laid paper. Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund. 1988-4-37.
